history.text: Hey!
Hi
Have you seen The Wolf of Wall Street?
I have, I really enjoyed it.  Have you?

Yes, I loved it. 
Martin Scorsese is an excellent director!
He is and Leonardo DiCaprio is a great actor
Love Leonardo Dicaprio. He was excellent in this movie, such a good fit
Agreed and casting Margot Robbie as his wife was the perfect pairing
Oh yes she is great as well
I'm surprised at some of the responses, though.
Some of the responses in here?
No, the critic responses. I see that it got a C CinemaScore. Some people said the characters were dull. I didn't find that to be true

Oh, I see.  Rotten Tomatoes is known to be very tough on it's critique.    I think the critical reposes forget that the scope of the movie was fairly narrow because they had to take a story and condense into a few hours.
Yes, you are right about that. A lot of times, Rotten Tomatoes does get it wrong. It was a tough movie to direct i'm sure
I am interested in Penny Stocks, so I thought this movie had a good premise of what Penny Stocks are and how they can cause some serious damage
Yes, especially when left unregulated.
Yes, absolutely! Jonah Hill is a great actor as well
Agreed.  I am so use to seeing him in comedy roles, it was refreshing see him play this role.
Yes.. I don't think anyone thought he could pull that off, haha
Things on Wall Street are pretty similar today. Everyone is out to make money for themselves
It will always be that way.  I think a lot of people could relate to the movie.  its why it made it wildly successful
Yes, I think you're right about that
Leo definitely should of won an Oscar for this one

Not saying they can relate to Jordan Belfort.  He was a outlier.  He made lots of illegal trades.  Got caught up in the drugs an alcohol scene.  But the industry and the riches that can potentially come with it

Absolutely! The illegal trading aspect of it isn't great. But I feel like there are so many people who do the same thing. Especially with the drugs and alcohol. I'm sure a ton of Wall Streeters live that exact lifestyle
One of my favorite scenes is when he secures the Steve Madden IPO.  it was also his downfall
Oh yes! That was a good scene. Very realistic as well
Also, when Naomi decided to divorce him and take his kids
Then the scene where Jordan gets arrested.  it kind of all brings it full circle
And it actually made me feel bad for him.. As rotten as he was, you couldn't help to feel bad
He made the best of his situation though.  I believe he now goes around the country an gives speeches on sales
Yes he does! And I'm sure he's doing very well doing that
He got lucky only getting a few years in prison
white collar crime, i guess they went easy on him
Yeah, plus he was in minimum security so he didn't get it too bad
